Salary: £46,148 - 52,809 per year
Reference: 62305

Speech and Language Therapist ( SALT ) - Neuro Rehabilitation Centre ( Band 7 )
Location: Leatherhead, Surrey
Salary: £37,338 - £44,962 per annum (depending on experience)
Hours: 37.5 hours FTE (Part-time hours also available)

About the Role

AXIA Healthcare is proud to partner with a nationally respected provider of health and social care services, specialising in neurological rehabilitation for both adults and young people.

We are seeking a passionate and experienced Speech and Language Therapist ( Band 7 ) to join a modern, purpose-built 48-bed Neuro Rehabilitation Centre in Leatherhead, Surrey. This outstanding facility supports individuals recovering from acquired brain injuries, strokes, incomplete spinal injuries, and other neurological conditions-delivering bespoke therapy programmes within a 24-hour nursing care environment.

Whether you are a Band 6 looking to take the next step in your career, or an existing Band 7 looking for a new and rewarding challenge, this is a fantastic opportunity to be part of an innovative and supportive multi-disciplinary team.

What You'll Be Doing

As a senior member of the SLT team, you will take a lead role in delivering and developing specialist communication and swallowing therapy services for adults with complex neurological needs. Your responsibilities will include:

  • Leading and delivering individual and group-based neurorehabilitation programmes

  • Conducting specialist assessments for speech, language, communication, and swallowing difficulties

  • Providing high-quality therapy to both inpatients and outpatients

  • Taking the lead in the development and growth of the SLT service

  • Advising clients, families, and staff on safe dysphagia management

  • Contributing to service innovation through reflective practice and evidence-based care

What We're Looking For

We're looking for a committed and compassionate therapist who brings a high standard of clinical expertise and leadership. You'll need:

  • Qualifications: Degree or diploma in Speech and Language Therapy and HCPC registration

  • Professional Membership: Registered member of the Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)

  • Experience: Proven experience in neurorehabilitation and working with clients with complex neurological needs

  • Values: A person-centred approach, a team-focused mindset, and a passion for continuous improvement in care

Employee Benefits Package

In return, you'll receive a competitive salary and an excellent benefits package, including:

  • Annual Leave: 25 days + 8 bank holidays (increasing to 27 after 3 years, and 28 after 4 years)

  • Life Assurance: 4x basic salary - ideal for mortgage and rental applications

  • Health & Wellbeing: Access to the Westfield Health cashback scheme, shopping discounts, and Blue Light Card

  • Pension Scheme

  • Enhanced Sick Pay

  • Career Development: Ongoing CPD, in-house training, reflective practice, and tailored supervision

  • Free On-site Parking

  • Visa Sponsorship: Tier 2 visa sponsorship available for candidates already in the UK

  • Team Culture: All staff take part in our 'key therapist/worker' programme, helping to build strong therapeutic relationships

  • Cutting-edge Practice: Attend VF clinics and continue developing your dysphagia competencies

Be Part of Something Bigger

This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing, values-led organisation that truly prioritises both patient outcomes and professional development. You'll play a key role in shaping the future of our neurorehabilitation services.

How to Apply

To find out more or to apply, please contact:
Erin Giles - call or WhatsApp: 07927 531 438
Email: erin.giles@axiahealthcare.co.uk

Job Introduction 
 Job title: Finance and Procurement Functional Analyst A bit about us: Liverpool is home to vibrant, energetic, and engaged communities, people who take real ownership of their local area and are passionate about making our city a better place. We've got ambitious targets to meet by 2027 and we need people who are driven, dynamic and ready to deliver the very best for our communities. Public service is more important than ever, and this role represents a real opportunity to make a difference to our communities by transforming the way we work and placing our residents at the heart of everything we do. Working at Liverpool City Council provides an opportunity to contribute to your community and make a positive impact on the lives of residents. Our values shape how we work to deliver public services, and how we communicate with the residents we serve. We care about the best outcomes for local people, through our public services. We are proud of our world-famous thriving city with its rich culture, as well as affordable housing, good schools, beautiful green spaces – there’s really something for everyone! The role: As part of our transformation journey, Liverpool City Council is implementing an integrated Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system that will transform our Finance, Human Resources, and Payroll functions. The new ERP system will replace our current SAP (Finance) and Oracle (Payroll) platforms, along with several smaller systems covering other functions within Finance and Resources and HR and Payroll. It will be built using Microsoft Dynamics for Finance and Resources, and MHR i-Trent for HR and Payroll. We are looking to stand up a team of experts to work in partnership with EY, who have been appointed to deliver the integrated solution, and internal subject matter experts to help shape the future of how we work, ensuring we deliver the best outcomes for staff and residents. We are looking to recruit four fixed term Finance and Procurement Functional Analysts to provide support across areas of design, programme management, and testing for Finance and Procurement related functions throughout the implementation of an Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) programme. The ideal candidates will have proven experience in delivering finance and/or procurement project objectives which require strong attention to detail whilst juggling tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment. As a Functional Analyst, you will be confident in collaborating with a variety of stakeholders with the ability to communicate technical information to a range of technical and non-technical stakeholders. You should also hold a relevant qualification in Finance or Procurement and/or proven experience in Finance and/or Procurement functions These positions are fixed term for the purposes of supporting and delivering the organisation's Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Programme and will end on 30 April 2027. Our offer to you:   At least 27 days holiday, plus bank holidays rising to 32 after 5 years’ service (pro rata if part time) - option to purchase further days  Agile working (role dependent) - a “Flexibility First” approach to agile working, where flexibility is the norm rather than the exception  Part of the Local Government Pension Scheme – option to join the AVC Scheme  Progression - opportunities and training through a wide range of high quality learning  Health and Wellbeing - offer including Employee Assistance Programme  Cycle to Work and Travel Pass Schemes  Drive Time – a salary sacrifice car lease scheme  Family friendly policies with enhanced leave  Discounted Gym Memberships  Employee Volunteering Scheme  Medicash  Next steps: Closing date: midnight on Sunday 21 September 2025 Shortlisting date: W/C 22 September 2025 Interview date: W/C 22 and 29 September 2025 (TBC) Interview type: face-to-face (TBC) We reserve the right to close vacancies earlier than the specified date should we receive sufficient applications.      Method of Assessment will be through one or more of the following Application Form, Test, Interview, and Certificate
     Skills Required    Ability to find and implement creative and innovative solutions to complex managerial problems.     Knowledge Required    Knowledge and familiarity of current working practices of key partners to support commissioning activity. (education, early years, youth work, family support, complex needs, youth offending, social work, public health, children’s transport, residential and housing support services)  Understanding/experience of a range of improvement methodologies to drive service improvement     Experience Required    Management/supervisory experience within the relevant children’s services environment (i.e. schools, colleges, or local authority) with specific responsibility for implementing policy via service delivery and outcomes.  Experience of developing and managing strategies leading to successful outcomes for children within the relevant environment. Senior Operations Manager

Company: Prostar Cleaning Company

Location: Portsmouth, United Kingdom

Employment Type: Full-Time, Permanent

Visa Sponsorship: Available for exceptionally qualified international candidates under the Skilled Worker program

About Prostar Cleaning Company

Prostar Cleaning Company is an industry leader in the south region of the United Kingdom, delivering premier commercial cleaning, construction site remediation, and facilities maintenance services. We operate across diverse sectors, including domestic, industrial, hospitality, and large-scale infrastructure. Renowned for our operational excellence, innovative methodologies. Consistently driven by a commitment to quality, compliance, and sustainability, Prostar continues to expand its footprint, and needs driven managers who can combine financial skills with operational leadership to support our growth.

Role Overview

We are seeking a strategic and results-driven Senior Operations and Finance Manager to oversee and optimize complex, multi-regional operations across Prostar’s core business verticals, manage the budget, and ensure client satisfaction. This pivotal leadership position requires a strong background in business management and finance, business operations, and large-scale client relationship management.

Key Responsibilities

As Senior Operations and Finance Manager, you will play a central role in steering the company’s operational strategy, providing strategic operational leadership, directing and coordinating multi-site operations while aligning delivery teams across cleaning, construction, and maintenance projects to achieve organizational objectives and contractual KPIs.

Manage budget and financial reporting for multi-site operations, drive cost control and efficiency while maintaining service quality, use business financial and operational data to identify inefficiencies, and embed a culture of continuous improvement for processes and decision-making throughout the business

Support client relationship management and contract compliance,

You will spearhead the development, implementation, and continuous refinement of standard operating procedures and quality systems aligned with international standards such as ISO 9001 and ISO 45001, ensuring compliance with complex health, safety, and environmental regulations, driving enterprise-wide process standardization, embedding global best practices, and ensuring rigorous adherence to all regulatory and contractual obligations.

Additionally, you will serve as the senior escalation point for our high-value clients, cultivating strategic partnerships, negotiating renewals, and spearheading the development of innovative service offerings. You will ensure strict compliance with local, national, and international labor laws and environmental directives, maintaining audit readiness at all times.

Equally important is your role in people leadership: inspiring, coaching, and developing a diverse workforce to foster a high-performance culture built on accountability, collaboration, and professional growth.

This role is essential to fortify Prostar’s ambitious growth trajectory and underpin our long-term global talent strategy.

Qualifications & Professional Profile

Bachelor’s degree in Business Management, Finance, or related field

5years and above experience in operations, Finance, and Business Management

You will demonstrate knowledge of regulatory compliance frameworks and operational excellence models.

Strong budgeting, reporting, and organizational skills

Experience in ERP systems, CAFM software, and data-driven reporting tools is advantageous, alongside outstanding analytical and problem-solving abilities.

Professional certifications, such as PMP, Lean Six Sigma, or NEBOSH, will be highly advantageous. (not essential)

You must also exhibit exceptional cross-cultural communication and leadership skills, with the ability to engage effectively.

What We Offer

Competitive Salary with performance-related bonuses, enhanced pension contribution, and a fully maintained company vehicle with allowance.

Relocation support/skilled worker visa sponsorship

We provide opportunities for professional advancement and involvement in professional development programs for advanced industry certifications.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: £42,000.00 per year

Work Location: In person

Lead complex negotiations and business development activities, ensuring agreements reflect both technical requirements and commercial opportunities. Represent Jisc to members, funders, and customers, demonstrating the impact and value of licensing activities through clear reporting and strategic communications. Monitor trends in research software, data infrastructure, and digital services to inform licensing decisions and ensure the portfolio remains highly relevant and future-proof. We foster a culture of continuous learning and personal growth, offering opportunities to develop new skills and make a real impact in education and research. With a strong focus on work-life balance, we embrace flexible working that prioritises outcomes over hours, empowering you to create a rhythm that energises both your professional and personal life.  Our Guiding Principles: Jisc’s culture is powered by our four guiding principles: putting customers first, driving innovation, creating impact, and championing inclusive collaboration to deliver sustainable outcomes and shape a better future.  Discover the amazing benefits we provide! Application process: Please let us know how we can best accommodate you throughout the recruitment process. We’re committed to making our process accessible and comfortable for everyone - just tell us what works best for you.  Just so you know, we review CVs as soon as we can and aim to provide an update on your application within 4 weeks of receiving it. However, you may hear from us a lot sooner, so please keep an eye out for our emails or calls!  We’re really looking forward to getting to know the real you. While we encourage the use of AI tools to help you get started on your CV or cover letter, we encourage you to review your application before submitting. Make sure it truly reflects your own voice, experiences, and personality.  If you are currently a Jisc employee, please apply through your Dayforce Employee profile.  We have a thorough background screening process that verifies the details you share with us in your CV and your application. Any inaccurate information supplied during the application stages can lead to a job offer being withdrawn.  Sponsorship: Jisc has an active sponsor licence to recruit on a Skilled worker visa basis. Candidates wishing to apply who require sponsorship should determine the likelihood of obtaining a Certificate of Sponsorship for the role by assessing their circumstances against the relevant Home Office criteria. Jisc does not offer any financial re-imbursement towards the applicant costs, such as re-location, skilled worker visa and dependant costs or the immigration health charge.  No agencies please.

Join Our Multi-Disciplinary Team – A Unique Opportunity Awaits!

Are you passionate about technology and healthcare? This is your chance to become part of a dynamic team where your enthusiasm and willingness to learn will be valued and nurtured.

We’re looking for someone who is eager to gain broad experience in the maintenance of medical equipment, with a strong foundation in electronics and a commitment to professional development.

You’ll play a key role in supporting the Clinical/Technical services of MEMD, including:

Planned maintenance of medical devices

Assisting with repairs, acceptance testing, and equipment condemnation

Servicing community-deployed sleep therapy/CPAP devices in respiratory clinics

Progression through the MEMD competence profile

Attendance at manufacturer training courses for complex medical devices

Provide specialised clinical technical services for planned preventive maintenance (PPM), servicing, inspection and repair to a wide range of complex and patient-critical medical devices and systems.

Job Introduction 
 Job Title: Testing Lead A bit about us: Liverpool is home to vibrant, energetic, and engaged communities, people who take real ownership of their local area and are passionate about making our city a better place. We've got ambitious targets to meet by 2025 and we need people who are driven, dynamic and ready to deliver the very best for our communities. Public service is more important than ever, and this role represents a real opportunity to make a difference to our communities by transforming the way we work and placing our residents at the heart of everything we do. Working at Liverpool City Council provides an opportunity to contribute to your community and make a positive impact on the lives of residents. Our values shape how we work to deliver public services, and how we communicate with the residents we serve. We care about the best outcomes for local people, through our public services. We are proud of our world-famous thriving city with its rich culture, as well as affordable housing, good schools, beautiful green spaces – there’s really something for everyone! The Role: As part of our transformation journey, Liverpool City Council is implementing an integrated Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system that will transform our Finance, Human Resources, and Payroll functions. The new ERP system will replace our current SAP (Finance) and Oracle (Payroll) platforms, along with several smaller systems covering other functions within Finance and Resources and HR and Payroll. It will be built using Microsoft Dynamics for Finance and Resources, and MHR i-Trent for HR and Payroll. We are looking to stand up a team of experts to work in partnership with EY, who have been appointed to deliver the integrated solution, and internal subject matter experts to help shape the future of how we work, ensuring we deliver the best outcomes for staff and residents. The Testing Lead will own the delivery of all LCC owned testing phases on the ERP programme. They will be responsible for managing a team of testers and the SI to successfully delivery each phase, from the preparation of test scripts through to managing the resources needed to deliver UAT. As the Testing Lead you should have extensive experience with manual and automated testing tools, including defect tracking systems, performance testing, and security testing tools. Also experience working in ERP environments and understanding of data flows, integration points, and critical business processes in this area. This role is fixed term for the purpose to lead the delivery of test work within the Enterprise Resource Planning (EPR) programme and will end 31st March 2027. Our offer to you:   At least 27 days holiday, plus bank holidays rising to 32 after 5 years’ service (pro rata if part time) - option to purchase further days  Agile working (role dependent) - a “Flexibility First” approach to agile working, where flexibility is the norm rather than the exception  Part of the Local Government Pension Scheme – option to join the AVC Scheme  Progression - opportunities and training through a wide range of high quality learning  Health and Wellbeing - offer including Employee Assistance Programme  Cycle to Work and Travel Pass Schemes  Drive Time – a salary sacrifice car lease scheme  Family friendly policies with enhanced leave  Discounted Gym Memberships  Employee Volunteering Scheme  Medicash  Next steps: Closing date: midnight Friday 19th September 2025 Shortlisting date: W/C Monday 15th and Monday 22nd September 2025 Interview date: W/C Monday 22nd September 2025 Interview type: Face to Face competency based interview We reserve the right to close vacancies earlier than the specified date should we receive sufficient applications. If interested, please complete an application as early as possible. Please note: this vacancy is classified as a politically restricted position. If you would like any further information or an informal discussion, please contact Dave Forshaw via email dave.forshaw@liverpool.gov.uk Watch our recruitment video and see what life is like working at Liverpool City Council.   Liverpool City Council is committed to fostering a workforce representative of the communities we serve. As an Equal Opportunities Employer, we believe in appointing candidates based on their skills, experience, qualifications, and abilities. To support this commitment, we guarantee an interview to candidates from under-represented groups who meet the minimum essential criteria for the role. If you require any reasonable adjustments in line with the Equality Act 2010, such as an application form in a different format or additional time to complete your application, please contact us at recruitment@liverpool.gov.uk. Although we advertise on Jobs Go Public, and other websites, your application process will be directed to our Tribepad system. Please note that all communication regarding your application for this post will be sent to the email address that you have registered on Tribepad, including your invite to interview if you are shortlisted. Please check your emails regularly, including Spam/Junk, after the closing dates for notifications. Please ensure you complete your full profile, work and education history in Tribepad. Eligibility to work in the UK will be verified in the final stages of the selection process. All candidates must either already have a right to work in the UK before commencing employment or meet the Home Office criteria for Visa sponsorship.
